text.text: What circumstances might necessitate sending an off-schedule statement to a patient?

text: Off-schedule statements are sent to patients when there is a change in their insurance coverage or when a claim is denied. The statement will include the updated insurance information and the reason for the denial.

text.text: Can you explain why it's important to have the capability to send off-schedule statements in ZOLL Billing?

text: It's important to have the capability to send off-schedule statements in ZOLL Billing because it allows you to send statements for a patient request, a return mail indicating a mistaken address, etc.

text.text: Where can users access the option to send an off-schedule statement in ZOLL Billing?

text: To send an off-schedule statement, you can go to the patient's account page and click the Patient responsibility tab. Scroll down to the patient statement area and you will see when the last statement was sent. Click Send an off-schedule statement. The statement for that account is queued and will be sent in the nightly batch.

text.text: Is there any limitation on the number of off-schedule statements that can be sent to a patient?

text: The schedule tells the system how often to send a patient statement and the maximum statements to send. For example, the schedule can be set to "Sent every 15 days for up to 5 statements".

text.text: How does sending an off-schedule statement affect the patient's billing history?

text: To send an off-schedule statement, you can go to the patient's account page and click the Patient responsibility tab. Scroll down to the patient statement area and you will see when the last statement was sent. Click Send an off-schedule statement. The statement for that account is queued and will be sent in the nightly batch.

text.text: Is there any confirmation process or notification when initiating the sending of an off-schedule statement?

text: There is no confirmation process or notification when initiating the sending of an off-schedule statement.

text.text: What information is included in an off-schedule statement generated by ZOLL Billing?

text: ZOLL Billing will not generate patient invoices on future claims associated with this account. However, if the patient has insurance, the claim will still be sent to the insurance provider.

text.text: How does ZOLL Billing handle the queuing and sending of off-schedule statements?

text: To send an off-schedule statement, you can go to the patient's account page and click the Patient responsibility tab. Scroll down to the patient statement area and you will see when the last statement was sent. Click Send an off-schedule statement. The statement for that account is queued and will be sent in the nightly batch.

text.text: Can you describe the impact of sending off-schedule statements on the patient's account status?

text: ZOLL Billing will not generate patient invoices on future claims associated with this account. However, if the patient has insurance, the claim will still be sent to the insurance provider.

text.text: What measures can users take to verify that an off-schedule statement has been successfully sent?

text: The account displays under the "Final statement sent" tab on the Patient Billing page. To remove the suspension, click "Send another statement". This action removes the account from the list on the "Final statement sent" tab and changes the status on the claims associated with the account to "Queued for submission - Patient statement".
